A Decade of Spirited Hospitality FOOD & WINE Global Tastemakers 15 Best Bars in the U.S. USA TODAY 10BEST Awards Top 10 Best Hotel Bar Frequently asked questions What makes The Bar at The Spectator Hotel unique in Charleston? The Bar is celebrated for its award-winning cocktails, crafted by expert mixologists in a stylish, intimate setting. It’s frequently recognized among Charleston’s best hotel bars. Do guests need a reservation to visit The Bar? No reservations are required—it’s first-come, first-served. Guests can also enjoy cocktail service from their butler in the comfort of their own room. Has The Bar at The Spectator Hotel been featured in travel magazines? Yes, our bar has been highlighted by major travel publications for its style and craftsmanship, further cementing its reputation as one of Charleston’s finest cocktail experiences. Does The Spectator Hotel have an on-site restaurant? The Spectator Hotel does not have an on-site restaurant. However, The Spectator Hotel does have a craft cocktail bar and lounge, The Bar at The Spectator, which serves light bar food bites, and a variety of beer, wine, and cocktails. It is open daily — Sunday through Thursday from 3 - PM and 3 - 11 PM on Fridays and Saturdays. Additionally, there are dozens of restaurants within walking distance for your enjoyment. What time does the bar open? The Bar is open daily at 3 PM to the public. Any time after 10 AM, we pour beer, wine, champagne or a basic mixed drink (excluding our signature cocktails) for in-house guests. Our signature cocktails are available during The Bar's regular operating hours. Does The Spectator Hotel offer in-room dining? The Spectator Hotel offers a limited in-room dining menu, served from and inspired by The Bar. Our butler staff will deliver to your guest room from 3 - 9 PM daily. Additionally, the butler team is able to pick up food from local restaurants within a two block radius of The Spectator Hotel and deliver it to your room should you wish to dine in. This will incur a 20% convenience fee. Can The Spectator Hotel's Butlers help with dining requests? Yes, The Spectator Hotel's private butlers are here to help coordinate any dining needs you may have — making reservations, ordering from local restaurants, picking up your meal, and other special requests. Just ask!
